19#include <algorithm>
20#include <cstdint>
21#include <utility>
22#include <vector>
23
24#include "Matrix.h"
25#include "ZXConfig.h"
26
27namespace ZXing {
28
29class BitArray;
30class ByteMatrix;
31
32/**
33* <p>Represents a 2D matrix of bits. In function arguments below, and throughout the common
34* module, x is the column position, and y is the row position. The ordering is always x, y.
35* The origin is at the top-left.</p>
36*
37* <p>Internally the bits are represented in a 1-D array of 32-bit ints. However, each row begins
38* with a new int. This is done intentionally so that we can copy out a row into a BitArray very
39* efficiently.</p>
40*
41* <p>The ordering of bits is row-major. Within each int, the least significant bits are used first,
42* meaning they represent lower x values. This is compatible with BitArray's implementation.</p>
43*
44* @author Sean Owen
45* @author dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin)
46*/
47class BitMatrix
48{
49 int _width = 0;
50 int _height = 0;
51 int _rowSize = 0;
52#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
53 using data_t = uint8_t;
54#else
55 using data_t = uint32_t;
56#endif
57 std::vector<data_t> _bits;
58 // There is nothing wrong to support this but disable to make it explicit since we may copy something very big here.
59 // Use copy() below.
60 BitMatrix(const BitMatrix&) = default;
61 BitMatrix& operator=(const BitMatrix&) = delete;
62
63 const data_t& get(int i) const {
64#if 1
65 return _bits.at(i);
66#else
67 return _bits[i];
68#endif
69 }
70
71 data_t& get(int i) { return const_cast<data_t&>(static_cast<const BitMatrix*>(this)->get(i)); }
72
73public:
74 BitMatrix() = default;
75#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
76 BitMatrix(int width, int height) : _width(width), _height(height), _rowSize(width), _bits(width * height, 0) {}
77#else
78 BitMatrix(int width, int height) : _width(width), _height(height), _rowSize((width + 31) / 32), _bits(((width + 31) / 32) * _height, 0) {}
79#endif
80
81 explicit BitMatrix(int dimension) : BitMatrix(dimension, dimension) {} // Construct a square matrix.
82
83 BitMatrix(BitMatrix&& other) noexcept : _width(other._width), _height(other._height), _rowSize(other._rowSize), _bits(std::move(other._bits)) {}
84
85 BitMatrix& operator=(BitMatrix&& other) noexcept {
86 _width = other._width;
87 _height = other._height;
88 _rowSize = other._rowSize;
89 _bits = std::move(other._bits);
90 return *this;
91 }
92
93 BitMatrix copy() const {
94 return *this;
95 }
96
97 [[deprecated]]
98 ByteMatrix toByteMatrix(int black = 0, int white = 255) const;
99
100#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
101 // experimental iterator based access
102 using iterator = data_t*;
103 struct Row
104 {
105 iterator _begin, _end;
106 iterator begin() noexcept { return _begin; }
107 iterator end() noexcept { return _end; }
108 };
109 Row row(int y) { return {_bits.data() + y * _width, _bits.data() + (y + 1) * _width}; }
110#endif
111
112 /**
113 * <p>Gets the requested bit, where true means black.</p>
114 *
115 * @param x The horizontal component (i.e. which column)
116 * @param y The vertical component (i.e. which row)
117 * @return value of given bit in matrix
118 */
119 bool get(int x, int y) const {
120#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
121 return get(y * _width + x) != 0;
122#else
123 return ((get(y * _rowSize + (x / 32)) >> (x & 0x1f)) & 1) != 0;
124#endif
125 }
126
127 /**
128 * <p>Sets the given bit to true.</p>
129 *
130 * @param x The horizontal component (i.e. which column)
131 * @param y The vertical component (i.e. which row)
132 */
133 void set(int x, int y) {
134#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
135 get(y * _width + x) = 1;
136#else
137 get(y * _rowSize + (x / 32)) |= 1 << (x & 0x1f);
138#endif
139 }
140
141 void unset(int x, int y) {
142#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
143 get(y * _width + x) = 0;
144#else
145 get(y * _rowSize + (x / 32)) &= ~(1 << (x & 0x1f));
146#endif
147 }
148
149 void set(int x, int y, bool val) {
150#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
151 get(y * _width + x) = val;
152#else
153 val ? set(x, y) : unset(x, y);
154#endif
155 }
156
157 /**
158 * <p>Flips the given bit.</p>
159 *
160 * @param x The horizontal component (i.e. which column)
161 * @param y The vertical component (i.e. which row)
162 */
163 void flip(int x, int y) {
164#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
165 auto& v =get(y * _width + x);
166 v = !v;
167#else
168 get(y * _rowSize + (x / 32)) ^= 1 << (x & 0x1f);
169#endif
170 }
171
172 void flipAll() {
173 for (auto& i : _bits) {
174 i = ~i;
175 }
176 }
177
178 /**
179 * Clears all bits (sets to false).
180 */
181 void clear() {
182 std::fill(_bits.begin(), _bits.end(), 0);
183 }
184
185 /**
186 * <p>Sets a square region of the bit matrix to true.</p>
187 *
188 * @param left The horizontal position to begin at (inclusive)
189 * @param top The vertical position to begin at (inclusive)
190 * @param width The width of the region
191 * @param height The height of the region
192 */
193 void setRegion(int left, int top, int width, int height);
194
195 /**
196 * A fast method to retrieve one row of data from the matrix as a BitArray.
197 *
198 * @param y The row to retrieve
199 * @param row An optional caller-allocated BitArray, will be allocated if null or too small
200 * @return The resulting BitArray - this reference should always be used even when passing
201 * your own row
202 */
203 void getRow(int y, BitArray& row) const;
204
205 /**
206 * Modifies this {@code BitMatrix} to represent the same but rotated 90 degrees clockwise
207 */
208 void rotate90();
209
210 /**
211 * Modifies this {@code BitMatrix} to represent the same but rotated 180 degrees
212 */
213 void rotate180();
214
215 void mirror();
216
217 /**
218 * Find the rectangle that contains all non-white pixels. Useful for detection of 'pure' barcodes.
219 *
220 * @return True iff this rectangle is at least minWidth x minHeight pixels big
221 */
222 bool findBoundingBox(int &left, int& top, int& width, int& height, int minSize = 1) const;
223
224 /**
225 * This is useful in detecting a corner of a 'pure' barcode.
226 *
227 * @return {@code x,y} coordinate of top-left-most 1 bit, or null if it is all white
228 */
229 bool getTopLeftOnBit(int &left, int& top) const;
230
231 bool getBottomRightOnBit(int &right, int& bottom) const;
232
233 /**
234 * @return The width of the matrix
235 */
236 int width() const {
237 return _width;
238 }
239
240 /**
241 * @return The height of the matrix
242 */
243 int height() const {
244 return _height;
245 }
246
247 /**
248 * @return The row size of the matrix. That is the number of 32-bits blocks that one row takes.
249 */
250 int rowSize() const {
251 return _rowSize;
252 }
253
254 bool empty() const {
255 return _bits.empty();
256 }
257
258 friend bool operator==(const BitMatrix& a, const BitMatrix& b)
259 {
260 return a._width == b._width && a._height == b._height && a._rowSize == b._rowSize && a._bits == b._bits;
261 }
262};
263
264/**
265 * @brief Inflate scales a BitMatrix up and adds a quite Zone plus padding
266 * @param matrix input to be expanded
267 * @param width new width in bits (pixel)
268 * @param height new height in bits (pixel)
269 * @param quietZone size of quite zone to add in modules
270 * @return expanded BitMatrix, maybe move(input) if size did not change
271 */
272BitMatrix Inflate(BitMatrix&& input, int width, int height, int quietZone);
273
274/**
275 * @brief Deflate (crop + subsample) a bit matrix
276 * @param matrix
277 * @param width new width
278 * @param height new height
279 * @param top cropping starts at top row
280 * @param left cropping starts at left col
281 * @param subSampling typically the module size
282 * @return deflated input
283 */
284BitMatrix Deflate(const BitMatrix& matrix, int width, int height, int top, int left, int subSampling);
285
286template<typename T>
287BitMatrix ToBitMatrix(const Matrix<T>& in, T trueValue = {true})
288{
289 BitMatrix out(in.width(), in.height());
290 for (int y = 0; y < in.height(); ++y)
291 for (int x = 0; x < in.width(); ++x)
292 if (in.get(x, y) == trueValue)
293 out.set(x, y);
294 return out;
295}
296
297template<typename T>
298Matrix<T> ToMatrix(const BitMatrix& in, T black = 0, T white = ~0)
299{
300 Matrix<T> res(in.width(), in.height());
301 for (int y = 0; y < in.height(); ++y)
302 for (int x = 0; x < in.width(); ++x)
303 res.set(x, y, in.get(x, y) ? black : white);
304 return res;
305}
306
307} // ZXing
308
